text:
Company Background:
Daniel-Miller is a globally recognized consultancy firm specializing in human capital management and organizational performance. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment that promotes collaboration, innovation, and excellence.

Job Type:
Full-time

Job Description:
We are seeking a Senior Human Capital Partnership and Performance Management Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will drive strategic human capital initiatives and performance management processes, ensuring alignment with overall business goals.

Responsibilities:
- Lead the design and implementation of performance management systems.
- Collaborate with various departments to identify human capital needs and solutions.
- Develop and execute strategic initiatives to improve organizational performance.
- Conduct data analysis to inform decision-making and measure the effectiveness of human capital strategies.
- Provide leadership and guidance to junior team members and stakeholders.

Qualifications and Experience Needed:
- Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
- Minimum of 7 years of experience in human capital management or performance management.
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Proven ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
- Proficiency in HR software and data analysis tools.

Perks and Benefits:
- Competitive salary ranging from $80,000 to $120,000 annually, based on experience and skills.
- Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
- Generous paid time off and flexible working arrangements.
- Professional development and continuous learning opportunities.
- Inclusive and supportive work culture.
